hero.title: Food diary app that helps you build a healthier relationship with food.
hero.subtitle: Track moments, feelings and patterns without pressure.

primary.title: You can start right away
primary.description: The app is always available as a website. No download required. Add it to your home screen and begin today.

feedback.title: Our focus
feedback.description: We keep improving this app together with professionals and lived-experience experts. Your feedback helps us support recovery better.

simple.title: Simple
simple.description: One overview, one input form and one export flow. Minimal fields, clear structure and practical support.

accessible.title: Accessible
accessible.description: Use it on the web across your devices. With an account your diary stays available wherever you sign in.

safe.title: Safe
safe.description: Your data is stored with privacy and security in mind, so your diary remains personal.

features.heading: Product features
features.description: The Real You app offers you a simple and safe way to keep a food diary that supports your recovery.

moments.title: (Food) moments
moments.description: Track breakfast, lunch, dinner or a single moment with your thoughts and feelings.

withoutTriggers.title: Without triggers
withoutTriggers.description: No calorie counting, no strict rules and no judgment. Focus on awareness instead.

feelings.title: Feelings
feelings.description: Capture emotions quickly and add context in your own words.

behaviors.title: Behaviors
behaviors.description: Log behaviors like skipping meals or binge moments to recognize patterns.

export.title: Export
export.description: Select a date range and export a clear PDF to discuss with your care provider.

saved.title: Saved moments
saved.description: Mark important entries and filter them later in your overview or export.

footer.description: The Real You started during my own recovery process. Recovery is trial and error, while continuing to discover what works for you.
footer.quote: Success is not final, failure is not fatal. It's the courage to continue that counts.
